creator: fguiliani@perinfo.com
text:
While apache httpd 2.0.52 is compiling like a charm under redhat 7.3 with:
./configure --prefix=/subversion --enable-so --enable-dav --enable-deflate
--enable-ssl --enable-cgi --enable-vhost-alias --with-berkeley-db=/subversion
--with-dbm=db42 && make depend && make

Version 2.0.53 and 2.0.54 produce this error while compiling server/exports.c:
exports.c:1108: `apr_threadattr_stacksize_set' undeclared here (not in a function)

Version 2.0.55 produce those errors while compiling server/exports.c:
exports.c:356: `ap_log_cerror' undeclared here (not in a function)
exports.c:1109: `apr_threadattr_stacksize_set' undeclared here (not in a function)
exports.c:1139: `apr_procattr_addrspace_set' undeclared here (not in a function)

Version 2.0.58 and 2.0.59 produce those errors while compiling server/exports.c:
exports.c:115: `ap_set_receive_buffer_size' undeclared here (not in a function)
exports.c:288: `ap_get_server_revision' undeclared here (not in a function)
exports.c:362: `ap_log_cerror' undeclared here (not in a function)
exports.c:1115: `apr_threadattr_stacksize_set' undeclared here (not in a function)
exports.c:1145: `apr_procattr_addrspace_set' undeclared here (not in a function)


The problems is perhaps linked to the version of APR:
- httpd 2.0.52            is bundled with APR 0.9.5
- httpd 2.0.53 and 2.0.54 is bundled with APR 0.9.6
- httpd 2.0.55            is bundled with APR 0.9.7
- httpd 2.0.58 and 2.0.59 is bundled with APR 0.9.12

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Please capture the output of the configure command, and also the output of a
"make clean && make" command, and attach these separately to this bug report.

creator: fguiliani@perinfo.com
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Please capture the output of the configure command, and also the output of a
> "make clean && make" command, and attach these separately to this bug report.

I've attached the trace of configure, make depend and make from a fresh untared
source archive.

creator: fguiliani@perinfo.com
text:
I've tried to compile and install APR 0.9.12 and then compile HTTPD 2.0.52
--with-apr=/path/to/apr0.9.12 and I've got a similar error.

creator: fguiliani@perinfo.com
text:
The problem seems to come from old APR .h files who is located in
/subversion/include. This path is before the internals includes paths. I'm
trying to delete the old files.

rm -rf /subversion/include/[!d]* fix the problem.

I think that internal include path should be located before systems include path
to avoid this problem.
creator: fguiliani@perinfo.com
fguiliani@perinfo.com
text:
(In reply to comment #8)
> rm -rf /subversion/include/[!d]* fix the problem.

[!d]* is to exclude BerkeleyDB includes.

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: No update in several years and OS is ancient. Please re-open if this is a problem  in any currently viable OS+httpd release.
